page.title: 18Recreation - Greenkeeper
page.content: Malkins Bank golf course was laid down about 8 years ago on an industrial tip. It has been played on for about 5 years. It is a municipal course which means that anyone regardless of ability can play. The Greenkeeper begins work at 8:00 in the morning. 3 days a week he mows the greens. the height of the grass must be no more than 6mm. The hole is move 3 times a week. Every 2 weeks the grass is cut vertically to clean out weeds. 3 times a year the greens are fed with liquid manure and dressed with a sand compost. The greens need the most attention, followed by the tees, the fairways, the semi-rough and bunkers. The golf course is very popular and a daily average of 150-175 people use it. The weekends are the most popular time.
